intro: Tovomita calodictyos, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like, evergreen leaves that form a dense rosette near the ground. It produces a tall, erect stem that bears the showy inflorescence, which can reach up to 1 meter in height. Tovomita calodictyos is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
